dcterms:creator: Marten van Dijk
Ari Juels
Alina Oprea
Ronald L. Rivest
dcterms:description: FlipIt is a two-player game where an attacker and a defender compete for ownership of a shared resource, with players only receiving information on the current state upon making a move.
dcterms:title: FlipIt

dcterms:creator: Nicolas Falliere
Liam O Murchu
Eric Chien
dcterms:description: Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs) refer to stealthy and constant computer hacking processes that can compromise system or network security.
dcterms:title: Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs)

dcterms:creator: Marten van Dijk
Ari Juels
Alina Oprea
Ronald L. Rivest
dcterms:description: The Greedy strategy is a non-adaptive strategy that maximizes the agent's local reward based on the time passed since the opponent's last move.
dcterms:title: Greedy strategy (as described in van Dijk et al.)

dcterms:description: The Exponential Agent (EA) is a strategy characterized by random spacing between consecutive flips, making it harder to predict the agent's actions.
dcterms:title: Exponential Agent (EA)

dcterms:description: The Periodic Agent (PA) is a strategy that follows a fixed period for its actions, making it predictable.
dcterms:title: Periodic Agent (PA)

dcterms:description: n-player FlipIt extends the original FlipIt game to include multiple players, allowing for more complex interactions and strategies.
dcterms:title: n-player FlipIt
